## English

### Biostatistic resources for uOttawa students

This regroup the different resources developed for the biostatistic courses at the university of Ottawa
by [Julien Martin](people.qmd)  

#### Courses at uOttawa

* Undergraduate courses (BIO 4X58):
  * BIO4158 Applied biostatistics with R ([course site][4158_course] / [course manual][4158_manual])
  * BIO4558 Biostatistiques appliquées avec R([course site][4558_course] / [course manual][4558_manual])

* Graduate courses
  * BIO8940: Advanced biostatistics and open science ([course site][8940_course] / [course manual][8940_manual])

Graduate students can take both courses. Bio4x58 are intro classes that expect no or limited knowledge of R and no or limited knowledge of stats. Bio8940 expect a functional knowledge of R (loading data, running basic linear models, and making plots) as well as a good understanding of linear models (i.e. Bio8940 is a great next steps after completing Bio4x58).

#### Extra resources

* An introduction to R
  * english ([course][Rintro] / [course manual][R_way])
  * french ([course][introR] / [course manual][chemin_R])
